nodes.name: MerkleTrees

nodes.documentation:
@notice The first step towards computing a Merkle root is to allocate
a new tree by calling this function.
nodes.name: newTree

nodes.documentation:
@notice After allocating a tree, this function should be called
with each leaf data block.
nodes.name: setLeafDataBlock
computeRoot
verifyProof

devdoc.author: Edward Grech (@dwardu)
devdoc.details: The Merkle-tree implementation in this library uses different hashing functions for leaves and node-pairs, to guard against second pre-image attacks. See https://flawed.net.nz/2018/02/21/attacking-merkle-trees-with-a-second-preimage-attack/ Leaf data is passed to both functions unhashed.
devdoc.title: Generic Merkle-tree library

userdoc.notice: Functions to compute a Merkle-root and verify a Merkle-proof.
